metadata.title: CVE-2019-14892 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was discovered in jackson-databind in versions before 2.9.10, 2.8.11.5 and 2.6.7.3, where it would permit polymorphic deserialization of a malicious object using commons-configuration 1 and 2 JNDI classes. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-14892` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.10.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.0-2').
